issue.body:
1 - what happened,
Just following the Add new (Folder/Device), the focus is not in the first field.
- what I expected to happen instead.
  Get the focus in first field.

2 - what happened,
Parsing the fields in Add new folder popup with the keyboard Tab key, the focus won't hoover the Advanced settings section, preventing selection of items like Folder or Versionning types.
- what I expected to happen instead:
  Be able to reveal advanced settings with the keyboard.

3 - Also, maybe more difficult or not feasible, the "Ignore patterns" button doesn't show in folder creation popup. Because the creation processes was not yet ran to its end. One way could be: Save Folder creation, then popup "Do you wan't to add Ignore patterns?" yes|no , only on creation, as the button shows OK on Edit mode.
### Version Information

Syncthing Version: v0.14.6
OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04.5
Browser Version: FF38/48

body:
Because the workflow to work around it otherwise is crap. Consider that you get the "share folder" prompt because another device want to share the photos folder with you. You have a photos folder to share, but there are some files in it that should not be shared. Today you'd have to create the folder, make sure it's not shared with another device, then set the ignore patterns and make sure a rescan happens, and then share the folder with the other device. 

That's apart from the generally work saving measure of excluding the large ISO files you don't want shared, at  creation time. A scan isn't cancelable so otherwise you're stuck waiting for the unnecessary scan to complete before the files can be ignored. And even then they'll be part of the index exchange...

It also may be good idea to streamline "global ignores" there:
Right now, if you define `#include .stglobalignore` before the folder is actually in sync, it'll mark the folder as "Error", complaining that the file mentioned in `#include` is missing.
(not ideal, since you are going to sync "unwanted files" as well, just to get the `.globalignore` files)

Best case would be: 
1 - allow ignores editing, as calmh mentioned, upon folder creation 
2 - if user entered `#include`s there - don't fail straight away, and try to fetch files that are mentioned in `#include`  lines first. Settle the full ignore list with inclusions. Cary on to the rest of the synchronizations.

> @calmh  And even then they'll be part of the index exchange...

I might add: forever. :smile: , See #863 

## 

It would also be perfect to ask the user then, if he might want to take a "standard" ignored list into action. (At least it might be possible then for the wrappers)

issue.title: Populate ignore list during shared folder creation, to avoid useless indexing

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
hi,

I would like to make a suggestion.
When you create a shared folder, it is currently not possible to define an exclusion list before validating. Hence, the indexing starts by default in the whole folder, and continues while your go back to the folder setting and populate the exclusion list. It's problematic, for example, when you want to exclude the "#recycle" folder inside a Synology NAS, which may contains huge amount of files.

Would it be easy/possible to have access to the ignore list directly during the definition of the shared folder ?

Thanks !

### Version Information

Syncthing Version: all
OS Version: All

body:
Reading post and feature request for Pause all folders or devices, I idea hit my mind for this 3608:
We could either have a "Paused" check box in the dialog, or an additional button at the bottom : "_Save paused_" (if possible with a tooltip "_Useful e.g. to create ignore patterns before first sync_").

Whatever, we yet have 2 workarounds : 1st = don't populate the directory before setting stignore ; 2nd = Pause the intended devices before we start creating a folder that would need stignore..... 3rd = create both directory and .stignore from OS before creating the folder share.

body:
Hi guys
Today with 0.14.27rc3 I had the opportunity to test creating .stignore on folder creation. When the "Ignore Patterns" button is grayed out OK when no path is given yet (good thing), and becomes available only when a path is given. 
The problem is that the file is not created on "Save" ignores (even if the directory yet exists). The whole path would be created at this moment, before the share is when .stfolder is created on second Save click.
Only the file is updated when it pre-exists.
@bugith That sounds like a bug. Please file it as a new issue.
Oh, and thank you for catching this in a pre-release. It's much appreciated, my curt reply about the process of things notwithstanding. :)

issue.body:
When creating a folder share, specified Ignore Patterns won't save unless the _path/.stignore_ yet exists.
Since #3608 the Ignore Patterns button logic is OK (grayed when no path is given), but if it is not possible to create the full path to .stignore on create, then the button should not even show (or remain grayed) as long as the folder share is not created (then needing to re-open/edit the folder share to set Ignores, allowing to drop synching selected Ignores... and go to the directory tree to do some clean-up)
